items.title: In Lieu of Money, Toyota Donates Efficiency to New York Charity
items.abstract: Toyota engineers brought kaizen, a Japanese word meaning “continuous improvement,” to the Food Bank for New York City, cutting wait times at soup kitchens and streamlining procedures.
keywords: Food Bank for New York City

items.title: Turbines Popping Up on New York Roofs, Along With Questions of Efficiency
items.abstract: Two new wind turbine installations have gone up recently, and at least half a dozen more are on the horizon, though it remains to be seen how popular they will become.
keywords: New York State Energy Research and Development Authority

items.title: New York City Should Grade Buildings on Energy Efficiency
items.abstract: A simple tweak to an existing law could help the city reach its goal of reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 80 percent by 2050.

items.title: De Blasio Orders a Greener City, Setting Goals for Energy Efficiency of Buildings
items.abstract: Pledging to cut greenhouse gas emissions by 80 percent by 2050 from 2005 levels, the de Blasio administration plans to overhaul the energy standards in city buildings.

items.title: An Oily Challenge: Evict Stinky Old Furnaces in Favor of Heat Pumps
items.abstract: Building by building, New York and other cities are trying to stop the age-old use of fossil fuels to heat homes and buildings. In the U.S., new climate laws aim to speed things up.
